error.signature: States.Timeout: The state/task exceeded the maximum duration
error.regex: (States\.Timeout|Task .+ timed out|execution .+ exceeded .+ maximum duration|TimeoutSeconds exceeded)

verdict.summary: Step Functions state or execution exceeded its configured timeout, stopping the workflow.

dead_ends.action: Remove the TimeoutSeconds to have no timeout
dead_ends.why_fails: Without a timeout, stuck executions run forever and incur costs; default execution timeout is 1 year

dead_ends.action: Set very large timeout values to avoid the error
dead_ends.why_fails: Masks the underlying performance issue and leads to long-running expensive executions

workarounds.action: Add a Retry policy with exponential backoff for transient failures
workarounds.how: Add Retry block with States.Timeout error type, IntervalSeconds, MaxAttempts, BackoffRate in the state definition

workarounds.action: Optimize the underlying task (Lambda, ECS, etc.) or split into smaller steps
workarounds.how: Profile the slow task, break long operations into parallel Map states or sequential smaller tasks

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'States.Timeout: The state/task exceeded the maximum duration' vs 'You have exceeded the maximum volume limit for this account': while both are aws errors, the former Step Functions state or execution exceeded its configured timeout, stopping the  while the latter AWS account has reached the EBS volume limit for the region. Default limit varie.
